strong.span: We strive to maximize academic achievement and personal growth to enable all students to compete in the global economy.

extended learning information.

div.div: In the interest of keeping you informed, all updates regarding the Coronavirus will be posted here as well as in the Superintendent's Corner below....
Information on Emergency Childcare through the YMCA...
We are pleased to announce that last evening the school committee voted to eliminate the kindergarten fee beginning in the 2020-2021 school year. For...
Open Enrollment Applications are due May 1st. Please email completed applications to Donna Bergeron at dbergeron@beverlyschools.org...
Opening up your family portal account in Aspen is a three step process....
Informational Meeting for Beverly Public School Parents Regarding: ALICE...

div.span: All educational and non-academic programs, activities and employment opportunities at Beverly Public Schools are offered without regard to race, color, sex, religion, national origin, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender identity, homelessness, age and/or, disability, and any other class or characteristic protected by law.

p.span: In the interest of keeping you informed, all updates regarding the Coronavirus will be posted here.

span.style: font-size: 14px; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(227, 108, 9);
span.strong: The Beverly Public Schools will close beginning on March 16th through May 4th. The closures are a proactive step by our school community to limit the potential spread of COVID-19. To date, we are not aware of any confirmed or presumptive cases of the virus in our school community. We will be contacting families throughout the closure to provide information to parents and resources for students and families. Throughout the closure period, we will be making meals available similar to our Summer Meals Program. Please note that despite this closure, Massachusetts school districts have been informed that no district will have to go past June 30 and that school districts will not have to go beyond their planned 185th day of school. In Beverly the last day of school will be Thursday, June 25th.
